list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
On average it takes 10 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

content.description: Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.
This section asks for information on any changes to your business's turnover in the last month and expectations for the next month.
This section asks for information about:

list: prices of goods and services bought or sold over the last month and expectations for the next month
demand for goods and services over the last month
price rises experienced by your business

content.description: This section asks for information about your business's stock levels and stockpiling.
This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

list: percentage, for example, of those working from home, using a hybrid model or made redundant over the last month

content.description: This section asks for information about the changes to the numbers of workers from within and outside the EU.
We are asking these questions to help understand how workforce characteristics may have changed across different business sectors.
This section asks for information about current actions taken by your business to:

list: assess the impact of climate change on your business

content.description: We are asking this to understand how the UK Government's target of net zero carbon emissions may be affecting business's actions in relation to climate change.
This section asks for information about your business's overall performance.

The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions, about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)

blocks.title: Trading status of your business
blocks.description: This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.

questions.title: Which of the following statements best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s trading status?
questions.description:
You can interpret 'trading' as 'operating'.

Only select 'paused trading' if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

blocks.title: Turnover
blocks.description: This section asks for information on any changes to your business's turnover in the last month and expectations for the next month.

questions.title: How did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}’s turnover in May 2022 compare with the previous calendar month?

content.description: Exclude seasonal changes

questions.title: What are your business’s expectations for turnover in July 2022?
questions.description: When considering expectations compare to your business's current turnover.

options.label: Expect turnover to stay the same
options.value: Expect turnover to stay the same

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

blocks.title: Prices
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about:

  • prices of goods and services bought or sold over the last month and expectations for the next month
  • demand for goods and services over the last month
  • changes to energy prices
  • price rises experienced by your business

questions.title: How did the prices of goods or services bought by {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} in May 2022 compare with the previous calendar month?

content.description: Exclude seasonal changes

questions.title: How did the prices of goods or services sold by your business in May 2022 compare with the previous calendar month?

content.description: Exclude seasonal changes

questions.title: What are your business's expectations for the prices of goods or services sold in July 2022?
questions.description: When considering expectations compare to current prices of goods or services.

content.description: Exclude seasonal changes

questions.title: Which of the following factors, if any, are causing your business to consider raising prices in July 2022?

options.label: Finance costs
options.description: For example, commissions, fees and interest rates

options.label: Business is not considering raising prices
options.value: Business is not considering raising prices

questions.title: How did your business’s domestic demand for goods and services in May 2022 compare with the previous calendar month?

content.description: Include:

list: the volume of orders in your business’s total order book

content.description: Exclude:

questions.title: How did your business’s international demand for goods and services in May 2022 compare with the previous calendar month?

content.description: Include:

list: the volume of orders in your business’s export order book

content.description: Exclude:

questions.title: Has your business been affected by recent increases in energy prices?

content.description: Include:

options.label: Yes, both production and suppliers have been affected
options.value: Yes, both production and suppliers have been affected

options.label: No, the business has not been affected
options.value: No, the business has not been affected

questions.title: In which of the following ways, if any, has your business been affected by price rises?

content.description: Include any price rises that your business has experienced

options.label: Had to absorb costs
options.description: For example, business took no action or used cash reserves

options.label: Had to access more financial support
options.value: Had to access more financial support
options.description: For example, borrowing loans, issuing shares and bonds or taking on debt

options.label: Had to pass on price increases to customers
options.value: Had to pass on price increases to customers

options.label: Had to reduce staff work hours
options.value: Had to reduce staff work hours

options.label: Unable to maintain workspaces
options.description: For example, due to rising energy costs

options.label: The business has not been affected by price rises
options.value: The business has not been affected by price rises

blocks.title: Stock levels
blocks.description: This section asks for information about the business's stock levels and stockpiling.

questions.title: How did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s stock levels of raw materials in May 2022 compare with the previous calendar month?

content.description: Include:
Exclude:
This refers to the basic input goods that your business requires to manufacture its products.

questions.title: How did your business's stock levels of finished goods in May 2022 compare with the previous calendar month?

content.description: Exclude:
This refers to goods that have completed the manufacturing process and are ready for sale.

questions.title: Is your business stockpiling any goods or materials?

blocks.title: Workforce trends
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

  • percentage, for example, of those working from home, using a hybrid model or made redundant over the last month
  • changes to number of employees
  • difficulties with recruitment

questions.title: In May 2022, approximately what percentage of {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s workforce were:
questions.description:
If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

Your answers need to add up to 100%. If your workforce did not fall into any of the top five categories, enter '0', then use the 'Other' box at the bottom to bring the total to 100%.

Informed estimates are acceptable.

content.description: Include both full-time and part-time employees

answers.label: Using a hybrid model of working
answers.description: For example, using a mixture of working from home and a designated workspace

answers.label: On sick leave, or not working due to coronavirus (COVID-19) symptoms, self-isolation or quarantine

guidance.show_guidance: What we mean by a 'designated workspace'
guidance.hide_guidance: What we mean by a 'designated workspace'

content.description: This refers to a workplace, excluding the home.
Examples include:

list: community or shared work-spaces such as Hubs
work vehicles such as HGVs, vans and company cars

questions.title: How did the number of employees at your business in May 2022 compare with the previous calendar month?
questions.description:
Informed estimates are acceptable.

If you are a sole trader, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

content.description: Exclude seasonal changes

options.label: Number of employees stayed the same
options.value: Number of employees stayed the same

questions.title: What are your business’s expectations for the number of employees in July 2022?
questions.description:
Informed estimates are acceptable.

If you are a sole trader, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

When considering expectations compare to your business's current number of employees.

content.description: Exclude seasonal changes

options.label: Number of employees will stay the same
options.value: Number of employees will stay the same

questions.title: Did your business experience any difficulties recruiting employees in May 2022?

blocks.title: Workforce characteristics
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about the changes to the numbers of workers from within and outside the EU.

We are asking these questions to help understand how workforce characteristics may have changed across different business sectors.

questions.title: How has the number of workers from within the EU at {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} in May 2022 changed compared with this calendar month last year?

content.description: Exclude those from the UK (England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland)

options.label: Number of workers from within the EU has increased
options.value: Number of workers from within the EU has increased

options.label: We employ workers from within the EU, and the number has stayed the same
options.value: We employ workers from within the EU, and the number has stayed the same

options.label: Number of workers from within the EU has decreased
options.value: Number of workers from within the EU has decreased

options.label: Not relevant, as have not employed workers from within the EU
options.value: Not relevant, as have not employed workers from within the EU

questions.title: How has the number of workers from outside the EU at your business in May 2022 changed compared with this calendar month last year?

content.description: Exclude those from the UK (England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland)

options.label: Number of workers from outside the EU has increased
options.value: Number of workers from outside the EU has increased

options.label: We employ workers from outside the EU, and the number has stayed the same
options.value: We employ workers from outside the EU, and the number has stayed the same

options.label: Number of workers from outside the EU has decreased
options.value: Number of workers from outside the EU has decreased

options.label: Not relevant, as have not employed workers from outside the EU
options.value: Not relevant, as have not employed workers from outside the EU

blocks.title: Net-zero carbon emissions
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about current actions taken by your business to:

  • protect the environment
  • reduce carbon emissions
  • assess the impact of climate change on your business

We are asking this to understand how the UK Government's target of net zero carbon emissions may be affecting business's actions in relation to climate change.

questions.title: Which of the following actions, if any, has your business taken to protect the environment?

options.label: Has a net zero or greenhouse gas emissions target
options.value: Has a net zero or greenhouse gas emissions target

options.label: Has a net zero or greenhouse gas emissions target which includes supply chain
options.value: Has a net zero or greenhouse gas emissions target which includes supply chain

options.label: Has a nature or biodiversity strategy
options.value: Has a nature or biodiversity strategy

options.label: Has a nature or biodiversity target
options.value: Has a nature or biodiversity target

questions.title: Which of the following actions, if any, have you taken to reduce your business's carbon emissions?

options.label: Adjusting heating and cooling systems
options.description: For example, temperature, timings and reducing number of rooms being heated or cooled

options.label: Installing your own renewable electricity or heating
options.value: Installing your own renewable electricity or heating

options.label: Introducing a cycle to work scheme
options.value: Introducing a cycle to work scheme

options.label: No actions have been taken to reduce emissions
options.value: No actions have been taken to reduce emissions

questions.title: Have any of the following been used to assess the impact of climate change on your business's ability to operate?

content.description: Include the impact of climate change on supply chains

options.label: Assessment of demand for goods or services
options.value: Assessment of demand for goods or services

options.label: Assessment of finance, investments or insurance
options.value: Assessment of finance, investments or insurance

options.label: Resource efficiency assessment
options.description: For example, considering alternative energy sources

options.label: Technological assessment
options.description: For example, changes to plant, machinery and technology

blocks.title: Business confidence
blocks.description: This section asks for information about your business's overall performance.

questions.title: How would you describe your business’s overall performance in May 2022, compared with this calendar month last year?
questions.description: Consider all aspects of your business contributing to overall performance such as pricing, trading and workforce.

questions.title: How do you expect your business’s overall performance to change over the next 12 months?
questions.description: Consider all aspects of your business contributing to overall performance such as pricing, trading and workforce.

questions.title: Please tell us anything else about your business's current situation relating to topics covered in this survey

content.description: You have nearly finished! Make sure you continue to the next page and select submit answers at the bottom.
